dialogue.utterance: LA JETEE, a Chris Marker Film Production Draft June 27, 1994

dialogue.speaker: COLE
dialogue.context: JOSE's face is almost lost in shadow. What there is of it is youthful. He's just a scared Puerto Rican kid!
dialogue.speaker: JOSE
dialogue.context: JOSE immediately rolls over and feigns sleep as SCARFACE, a menacing guard with a jagged scar running down his cheek, looms close to COLE's cage and unlocks it.
dialogue.speaker: SCARFACE
dialogue.context: The PRISONERS in the other cages watch silently with narrowed eyes.
dialogue.speaker: COLE
SCARFACE
COLE
TINY
MICROBIOLOGIST
dialogue.utterance: Thank you. You two wait outside.
dialogue.speaker: SCARFACE
dialogue.utterance: He's got a history, Doctor. Violence. COLE'S eyes return to the walls.
dialogue.speaker: SCARFACE
ENGINEER
dialogue.utterance: I don't think he's going to hurt us. You're not going to hurt us, are you Mr. Cole? COLE'S head turns quickly to the ENGINEER.
dialogue.speaker: COLE
dialogue.context: The GUARDS exchange a look, shrug, exit, closing the door.
dialogue.speaker: MICROBIOLOGIST
dialogue.context: COLE goes to the empty chair at the conference table, sits down.
dialogue.utterance: Why don't you sit down, Mr. Cole.
dialogue.speaker: ASTROPHYSICIST
dialogue.utterance: We want you to tell us about last night.
dialogue.speaker: COLE
dialogue.context: The SCIENTISTS don't say anything. They just study him carefully.
dialogue.utterance: I went to the surface and I collected specimens like I was told.
dialogue.speaker: COLE
dialogue.utterance: I mashed the spider, didn't I?
dialogue.speaker: MICROBIOLOGIST
dialogue.utterance: We'll get to the spider later, Mr. Cole. Right now, we want to know everything that you saw.
